Class Train

java.lang.Object
Train
public class Train
extends java.lang.Object
Train class keeps track of the LinkedList of cars

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    Car front
    The next car, which starts are null

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Train​(java.lang.String carFile)
    constructor: reads each train car details from the file into the LinkedList

  • Constructor Details

    • Train

      public Train​(java.lang.String carFile) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      constructor: reads each train car details from the file into the LinkedList
      Parameters:
      carFile - The file to read the cars from
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - This is due to opening a scanner on a file

  • Method Details

    • detach

      public void detach​(java.lang.String factoryName)
      remove a car given factoryName, this should delete the node in the LinkedList.
      Parameters:
      factoryName - The factory to detach the cars for

    • attach

      public void attach​(java.lang.String factoryName, int stopNumber, java.lang.String materialName)
      add a new car(node) to the LinkedList
      Parameters:
      factoryName - the factory
      stopNumber - the stop number
      materialName - the material

    • search

      public void search​(java.lang.String factoryName)
      search for cars that correspond the given factory name. Note there may be more than one car so you may use helper method that follows
      Parameters:
      factoryName - the name of the factory to search for goods

    • getCars

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getCars​(java.lang.String factoryName)
      material name lookup given factory name
      Parameters:
      factoryName - the name of the factory to search for cars
      Returns:
      The list of cars that are going to that factory

    • displayTrainCars

      public void displayTrainCars()
      display all the train cars in sorted order

    • merge

      public void merge​(java.lang.String update) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      reads from update.txt and merges it with the new train car. Merge two LinkedLists and should maintain the sorted order.
      Parameters:
      update - the file to read the new Cars from
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - This is due to opening a scanner on a file
